title: The Problems With Trump's Multi-Front Trade Fight: DealBook Briefing
description: The Trump administration is discovering the difficulty of engaging in separate trade battles at the same time.

author: Natasha Lomas
title: UK parliament's call for Zuckerberg to testify goes next level
description: The UK parliament has issued an impressive ultimatum to Facebook in a last ditch attempt to get Mark Zuckerberg to take its questions: Come and give evidence voluntarily or next time you fly to the UK you’ll get a formal summons to appear. “Following reports …

author: Jeffry Bartash
title: US manufacturers battle highest prices since 2011 and other bottlenecks, ISM finds
description: American manufacturers grew at a slower pace in April, hindered by the highest prices since 2011 for raw materials such as steel as well as supply and labor shortages.

author: Michael Bartiromo
title: McDonald's customer takes bat to drive-thru window after being denied biscuits and gravy
description: A man in Lubbock, Texas, took out his aggression on a McDonald’s drive-thru window after learning the location would not be able to fulfill his breakfast order.

title: CPS, Nonprofit to Share $14M From Mark Zuckerberg Charity

author: Andrea Riquier
title: Construction spending stumbles in March but is stronger for the year to date
description: Spending on construction projects ticked down in March but from a revised February report that leaves the overall picture of spending much brighter in 2018.

author: Jayne O'Donnell
title: Feds warn e-cig liquid companies about packaging after thousands of kids drink toxic liquid
description: Children are at greater risk because exposure to the nicotine in e-liquid products, even in relatively small amounts, could result in acute toxicity. Death from cardiac arrest, as well as seizure and coma can occur.

author: Natalie Obiko Pearson
title: 'Amazon Effect' May Push Vancouver Housing Prices Even Higher
description: A spate of government policies have tried to temper Vancouver’s housing prices, to little avail. Now Amazon.com Inc. may give Canada’s costliest market another boost.

author: Joann Muller
title: No Way To Run A Factory: Tesla's Hiring Binge Is A Sign Of Trouble, Not Progress
description: What could possibly go wrong by flooding the assembly line with 1,000 or more newbies in a matter of weeks? Plenty.

author: Mark A. Walsh
title: 'We're in the Money': Sainsbury's Chief Sings Himself Into Trouble
description: The head of the British supermarket chain has had to apologize for “an unguarded moment” before a TV interview about a merger.

author: Michelle Lodge
title: Under Armour Tops Earnings and Sales Estimates but Shares Fall
description: Shares fall despite the athletic apparel company beating earnings forecasts....UAA

author: Tiffany Kary
title: Gibson Files for Bankruptcy With Deal to Renew Guitar Business
description: Gibson Brands Inc. filed for bankruptcy with a turnaround plan that will give some of the company’s lenders equity ownership of the iconic American business that’s supplied guitars to B.B. King, Elvis Presley and Pete Townshend.

author: Dawn Kopecki
title: SA loses another local company with Andeavor's $23 billion sale
description: For San Antonio, it's the fourth major homegrown company the city is losing to an outside buyer over the last 18 months.

author: Adam Levine-Weinberg
title: Ford Dumps Its US Sedan Lineup: Is It Making a Mistake?
description: Ford will stop selling all of its traditional sedans in the U.S. by 2020. But while Ford clearly needs to pull back in this part of the market, it may have gone too far.

author: Herb Weisbaum
title: Gas prices are going up — here are some simple ways to save at the pump
description: Yep, prices at the pump are going up, but these 3 everyday behaviors are also costing you money. Here's a better way to save.

author: Julie Johnsson
title: Boeing Agrees to Acquire Parts Supplier KLX for $3.25 Billion
description: Boeing Co. agreed to acquire KLX Inc. for about $3.25 billion as the world’s largest planemaker bolsters a fast-growing new division that offers maintenance, spare parts and other services to airlines.

author: Jay Greene
title: US Jury Convicts Former Autonomy CFO of Fraud in HP Deal
description: A federal jury found Autonomy’s former financial chief guilty of falsifying financial statements and exaggerating the British software maker’s value before its sale to Hewlett-Packard in 2011.

author: Michael Goldstein
title: Destruction Of Taxi Industry By Uber, Lyft Affects Trump Lawyer Michael Cohen
description: Trump attorney Michael Cohen is among many whose business has been disrupted by the near demise of the taxi industry caused by the rise of Uber and Lyft, now 70% of the business travel ground transportation market.

author: Michelle Lodge
title: Lawyers Advise Retailers to Pay Workers Back Wages Before Starbucks Ruling
description: Pay Your Employees Back Wages in Advance of Starbucks Ruling, Say California Lawyers...MCD

title: A black man was forced to pay upfront at a Chinese restaurant. He got his meal — and $10000.
description: Emile Wickham said he and his dining companions were discriminated against at Hong Shing Chinese Restaurant in Toronto.
